Vitalik Buterin Refocuses Ethereum on "World Computer" Vision for 2026  In his latest New Yearâ€™s address, Vitalik Buterin signaled that $ETH  Ethereum's 2025 technical wins must now lead to a revolution in real-world usability and decentralization. One-liner: Price has broken higher, but thin liquidity + unstable ETF flows still mean â€œrallies can get shaken out fast.â€ The quality of dips will be the real test.
â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•
Market Summary
Â· BTC recovered into the 90k zone and cleared a near-term resistance level; the key is whether it can hold.
Â· ETH also reclaimed the 3k zone; focus is less on price prints and more on whether flows stay supportive.
Â· Into year-end / early-year, CEX spot activity often thins out, making wick-heavy moves more likely in both directions.
Â· Post-options-expiry periods tend to be driven by positioning cleanup rather than clean trend; watch short-term volatility.
Â· Alts show â€œhigh volume but weak price,â€ suggesting leadership can shift from retail to larger players (quiet positioning).
Â· ETF headlines remain a drag; short-term capital â€œstickinessâ€ is being tested.
Â· Large transfers (e.g., to Coinbase) are not automatically â€œsellingâ€ and can reflect redemptions, custody moves, or liquidity ops.
Â· Bottom line: The rebound is visible, but the real signal is whether dips get absorbed rather than chased higher.
â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•
On-chain & Technical Trends
Â· Exchange balances trending lower favors absorption/range behavior over panic breakdowns.
Â· Long-term holder (LTH) distribution pressure remains low, thinning the overhead supply and making upside moves easier.
Â· â€œWhale buyingâ€ data can be distorted by exchange UTXO consolidation; validate data integrity before drawing conclusions.
Â· BTC is testing the upper end of the range: key support ~81,500; key upside reference ~102,600.
Â· Open interest is range-bound while estimated leverage can rise: liquidation-driven whipsaws are still structurally possible.
Â· Funding looks calmer overall, but frequent sharp local drops suggest periodic crowded-long unwinds.
Â· ETH shows persistent aggressive futures flow, yet price refuses to break downâ€”implying spot/OTC absorption beneath the surface.
Â· ETH exchange supply ratio (ESR) rising can signal short-term sell/hedge pressure and higher volatility risk.
â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•
Sentiment
Â· Fear & Greed is improving within the â€œFearâ€ zone: the market is moving away from extreme panic.
Â· â€œWeak sentiment but no further downsideâ€ can become a squeeze setup, but the fuel is still thinâ€”expect push-pull action.
Â· As the 4-year-cycle narrative weakens, participants shift toward supply/demand and liquidityâ€”short-term noise increases.
Â· ETF outflow narratives can keep psychology heavy, even if longer-term allocation trends remain intact.
Â· More â€œimplementationâ€ news (tokenization, onchain equities, RWA) can quietly support the medium-term backdrop.
Â· Vitalikâ€™s push to refocus on decentralization reinforces the long-term value thesis, but short-term is still flow-driven.
Â· Bottom line: The worst may be behind, but this is not a full trend reversalâ€”this is a â€œdoes the rebound persist?â€ phase.
â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•
U.S. Traditional Markets
Â· Early-year risk appetite is mixed; strength in gold/silver stands outâ€”risk-on is not uniform.
Â· U.S. manufacturing PMI remains in expansion but shows signs of cooling; watch rates and the dollar reaction.
Â· Small macro surprises can amplify volatility in thin markets, including crypto.
Â· JPMorganâ€™s tokenized money market fund highlights the shift from â€œexperimentsâ€ to â€œdeploymentâ€ in onchain finance (RWA tailwind).
Â· With CARF (2027) approaching, tax-data collection is starting across 48 countries: crypto is moving inside the tax infrastructure framework (medium-term institutionalization).
Â· Bottom line: Short-term can swing with rates/data; medium-term tends to benefit from liquidity and regulatory/infrastructure buildout.
â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•â€•
Overall Assessment
Score is 66. BTC/ETH have reclaimed key levels and sentiment is improving from fear, so the â€œrebound coreâ€ is forming. However, ETF flows remain unstable and thin liquidity means sharp pushbacks are still likely even during rallies.
Todayâ€™s key watchlist: (1) Can BTC hold the 90k zone (if yes, short-covering can extend) (2) Do ETF flows show a sustained turn (3) OI and leverage skew (liquidation risk) (4) Does Fear & Greed continue improving into the 30s+ (5) Does ETH ESR keep rising (sell/hedge pressure) or start rolling over (absorption winning).

âš– Is Decentralization Really Enough?   Ethereum ( $ETH  ) co-founder Vitalik Buterin just raised a quiet but serious concern. Crypto was built to resist power - yet power is finding new ways back in.   His point is simple ðŸ“Œ   In the past, power was limited by distance and friction. Today, software scales instantly. Once someone gets ahead, they donâ€™t just grow faster - they start shaping the whole system. Crypto isnâ€™t immune to that.   Decentralization alone wonâ€™t save us   Spreading users isnâ€™t enough if control still concentrates. What matters is diffusing power - making sure no single group can dominate, even as networks grow.   $ETH  's own staking is a good example. Lido holds a large share, but itâ€™s split across many operators with checks in place. Scale exists, control doesnâ€™t.   The takeaway ðŸ§    Web3 canâ€™t focus only on growth. In the next phase, balance may matter more than speed.   #ETH  #ETHBlockchain  #ETH 2#   #Macro Insights#

ETH ACCUMULATION IS HAPPENING -- AND STAKING IS PART OF IT

FXStreet data shows #Ethereum saw record inflows into accumulation addresses in December, even while selling pressure stayed elevated.

Thatâ€™s one side of it.

The other side is staking. More Ethereum continues to move into validator staking, which takes supply out of circulation entirely. Thatâ€™s not traders looking for a bounce -- thatâ€™s capital committing to the network for yield and long-term exposure.

So while price has been flat and sellers are still active, two things are happening at the same time:
ðŸ“Š $ETH is moving into wallets that historically donâ€™t sell quickly
ðŸ“Š $ETH is being locked up by validators and stakers

This doesnâ€™t mean price has to move tomorrow. It does mean supply is quietly tightening while turnover stays high.

Thatâ€™s usually not random behavior. ðŸ”¥
